title: Impact of corporate earnings reports on Rollins Inc stock's price movements

content.text: Rollins Inc released their Q2 2021 earnings report on July 28, 2021. The report showed strong financial performance, surpassing market expectations. Revenue increased by 35% compared to the same quarter last year, reaching $648.1 million. Earnings per share (EPS) also exceeded estimates, with a reported EPS of $0.23. These positive results demonstrated the company's ability to navigate the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic. As a result, the stock price of Rollins Inc rose by 8% in the immediate trading session following the earnings release.

On April 28, 2021, Rollins Inc announced its Q1 2021 earnings report. The company reported revenue of $524.6 million, representing a 13% increase compared to the same period in the previous year. However, the earnings per share (EPS) of $0.11 fell short of analysts' estimates. This mixed performance led to a slight decline in Rollins Inc's stock price by 1% on the day of the earnings release.

Rollins Inc released its Q4 2020 earnings report on January 27, 2021. The report revealed a strong finish to the year, with revenue of $536.3 million, marking a 13% increase compared to Q4 2019. The earnings per share (EPS) stood at $0.17, meeting analysts' expectations. The positive financial performance contributed to a 6% increase in the stock price of Rollins Inc on the day of the earnings release.

On October 28, 2020, Rollins Inc reported its Q3 2020 earnings. The company showcased impressive results with revenue of $580.7 million, reflecting a 6% growth from the same quarter last year. Additionally, earnings per share (EPS) exceeded expectations at $0.16. This strong performance led to a significant rise of 10% in the stock price of Rollins Inc following the earnings release.

Based on recent earnings reports, the impact on Rollins Inc stock's price movements varied. Positive earnings reports, such as the Q2 2021 and Q4 2020 reports, resulted in significant increases in the stock price. Conversely, mixed results, like the Q1 2021 report, led to a slight decline in the stock price. The Q3 2020 earnings report showcased strong financials and generated a notable upward movement in the stock price. Overall, the earnings reports play a crucial role in influencing investors' perceptions and subsequently affecting Rollins Inc stock's price.

news.headline: Here's Why Rollins Stock Plunged to a 52-Week Low Today
news.summary: Shares of pest-control company Rollins (NYSE: ROL) plunged to 52-week lows today after Spruce Point Capital maintained its strong-sell rating for the company.  Many investors believe that long-term winners keep winning -- but not Spruce Point Capital.  It believes that shares of Rollins could drop down to anywhere from $21.75 to $25.40 per share.

news.headline: ROLLINS, INC. SCHEDULES DATE FOR RELEASE OF THIRD QUARTER 2023 RESULTS
news.summary: Rollins, Inc. (NYSE: ROL) ("Rollins" or the "Company"), a premier global consumer and commercial services company, today announced that it will release its third quarter financial results for the period ended September 30, 2023, after the market closes on Wednesday, October 25, 2023. In conjunction with its release, the Company will host a conference call to review the Company's financial and operating results before the market opens on Thursday, October 26, 2023, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.
